content.description: This is on the north-facing wall of the Doughboy Boulder.  It has a great layback on the vertical rail, use some crimps on the right of the rail if need be.  Take it to the top.  This is a fun problem to get your blood pumping.  It is tall.
content.protection: Two pads or a pad and a spotter.
content.location:
On the Doughboy Boulder's north-facing wall, it is to the right of the

Doughboy Problem

if you are looking at the rock.

content.description: This is, in my opinion, the best line at Carter Lake. It climbs the Northeast arete of the doughboy boulder. Start with a left hand in the obvious, fist-sized pocket on the east-facing wall and a right hand on the arete. Figure out a way to get yourself up to the sidepull above the pocket with your left hand. Now comes the hard part. You have to get yourself up the arete by slapping and finding interesting foot placements. Halfway up there's a little rest and then a scary couple of moves to the top. If you think Kahuna roof is still the best route at Carter after sending, this I'll be surprised.
content.location: It is between the Little Debbie Boulder and the Kahuna Boulder. You can't miss it.
